info.title: Wardrobe BE (API)
info.description: This document describes the Wardrobe BE (API), built with Laravel (PHP), MySQL as the primary database, and Firebase for cloud storage and NoSQL data storage.

post.description: This authentication request is used to access the application and obtain an authorization token for accessing all protected APIs. This request interacts with the MySQL database.

401.description: account is not found or have wrong password

post.description: This authentication request is used to register / sign up new account. This request interacts with the MySQL database and broadcast with mailer.

409.description: username or email already been used

message.example: username or email already been used

post.description: This authentication request is used to validate request token for newly created account. This request interacts with the MySQL database.

message.example: account has been validated. Welcome flazefy

post.description: This authentication request is used to sign out from application or reset current session. This request interacts with the MySQL database.

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

delete.description: This request is used to delete a clothes by using given `ID`. This request interacts with the MySQL database, firebase storage, has a protected routes, broadcast message with Firebase FCM, and audited activity (history).

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

delete.description: This request is used to delete a clothes by using given `ID`. This request interacts with the MySQL database, broadcast message with Firebase FCM, has a protected routes, and audited activity (history).

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

post.description: This request is used to create clothes history record by giving `clothes_id`, `clothes_note`, and `used_context`. This request interacts with the MySQL database, and has a protected routes.

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

post.description: This request is used to create a clothes. This request interacts with the MySQL database, firebase storage, broadcast message with Telegram and Firebase FCM, using mailer, has a protected routes, and audited activity (history)

clothes_desc.example: Soft cotton t-shirt for daily use

message.example: clothes created, its called product A

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

delete.description: This request is used to permanently delete a dictionary entry based on the provided `ID`. This request interacts with the MySQL database, and has a protected routes

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

post.description: This request is used to create a new dictionary using the given `dictionary_type` and `dictionary_name`. This request interacts with the MySQL database.

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login
dictionary name must be at least 2 characters
dictionary type must be one of the following values inventory_category, inventory_unit, inventory_room, reminder_type, reminder_context, report_category
dictionary name has been used. try another

get.description: This request is used to get dictionary by its `dictionary_type`, that can be clothes_category, clothes_gender, clothes_made_from, clothes_size, clothes_type, day_name, track_source, used_context, wash_type, weather_hit_from. This request interacts with the MySQL database.

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

get.description: This request is used to get list of clothes's category and type from existed clothes. This request interacts with the MySQL database and has protected route.

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

delete.description: This request is used to permanently delete an error history based on the provided `ID`. However, it will also search for all errors with the same `message` and delete them. This request interacts with the MySQL database, and has a protected routes (Admin only).

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login

get.description: This request is used to get all error audit. This request interacts with the MySQL database, has a protected routes (Admin only), and a pagination.

200.description: Error fetched successfully. Ordered in ascending order by `created_at`

message.example: count(): Argument #1 ($value) must be of type Countable|array, null given

401.description: protected route need to include sign in token as authorization bearer

message.example: you need to include the authorization token from login | permission denied. only admin can use this feature

get.description: This request is used to get all feedback when user use the App. This request is using MySql database, have a protected routes, and has a pagination.

post.description: This request is used to create an outfit that will contain multiple set of clothes. This request interacts with the MySQL database, broadcast with Firebase FCM & Telegram, has a protected routes, and audited activity (history).

data.description: List of clothes attached to the outfit

telegram_user_id.description: Telegram user ID associated with the admin

telegram_is_valid.description: Indicates whether the Telegram account has been verified

created_at.description: Timestamp when the admin was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the admin was last updated

id.description: Primary key for the clothes item

clothes_merk.description: Brand or merk of the clothes

clothes_made_from.description: Material used to make the clothes, referenced from dictionary

clothes_type.description: Type of the clothes, referenced from dictionary

clothes_buy_at.description: Date when the clothes were purchased

is_faded.description: Indicates whether the clothes color has faded

has_washed.description: Indicates whether the clothes have been washed

has_ironed.description: Indicates whether the clothes have been ironed

is_favorite.description: Indicates whether the clothes are marked as favorite

is_scheduled.description: Indicates whether the clothes are scheduled for use

created_at.description: Timestamp when the clothes were created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the clothes

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the clothes were last updated

deleted_at.description: Timestamp when the clothes were soft deleted

id.description: Primary key for the clothes usage record

clothes_id.description: ID of the clothes item that was used

clothes_note.description: Additional note related to the clothes usage

used_context.description: Context of clothes usage, referenced from dictionary

created_at.description: Timestamp when the clothes usage was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the clothes usage record

dictionary_type.description: Type or group of the dictionary

message.description: Message or description of the error

stack_trace.description: Trail of function calls leading up to the error

file.description: Path of the file where the error is faced

line.description: Line of code in specific file where the error is faced

created_at.description: Timestamp when the error was faced

faced_by.description: ID of the user who specific faced the error

type.description: Type of the failed jobs on Task Scheduling

status.description: Status of the failed jobs on Task Scheduling

created_at.description: Timestamp when the jobs had failed

faced_by.description: ID of the user who affected by the error

feedback_rate.description: Rating value given by the user

created_at.description: Timestamp when the feedback was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who submitted the feedback

id.description: Primary key for the history record

history_type.description: Type or category of the history event

history_context.description: Context or description of the history event

created_at.description: Timestamp when the history record was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the history record

outfit_note.description: Additional note or description for the outfit

is_auto.description: Indicates whether the outfit is automatically generated

is_favorite.description: Indicates whether the outfit is marked as favorite

created_at.description: Timestamp when the outfit was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the outfit

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the outfit was last updated

id.description: Primary key for the outfitclothes relation

clothes_id.description: ID of the related clothes item

created_at.description: Timestamp when the outfitclothes relation was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the relation

id.description: Primary key for the outfit usage record

outfit_id.description: ID of the outfit that was used

created_at.description: Timestamp when the outfit usage was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the outfit usage record

is_show.description: Indicates whether the question is visible

created_at.description: Timestamp when the question was created

day.description: Day of the schedule (e.g., Mon, Tue)

is_remind.description: Indicates whether a reminder is enabled for the schedule

created_at.description: Timestamp when the schedule was created

created_by.description: ID of the user who created the schedule

clothes_id.description: ID of the related clothes item

telegram_user_id.description: Telegram user ID linked to the account

telegram_is_valid.description: Indicates whether the Telegram account has been verified

firebase_fcm_token.description: Firebase Cloud Messaging token for push notifications

created_at.description: Timestamp when the user was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the user was last updated

created_by.description: User ID who created the request
User ID who created the track
User ID who created the weather data
User ID who created the wash

bearerAuth.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme
